name: inorganically
content:
inorganically adverb
(PRODUCE FOOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
using artificial chemicals in the growing or raising of plants and animals for food and other products: These carrots have been grown inorganically. The inorganically fertilized wheat produced a higher yield.
More examplesFewer examplesThis soil has more organic carbon than inorganically fertilized soils.I prefer to eat good food that is grown inorganically rather than bad food that is grown organically.You can always use a pesticide to keep weeds off the path inorganically.

inorganically adverb
(DEVELOP)
business
  specialized If a business grows inorganically, it buys other companies rather than developing its own business: If you want your business to grow inorganically, you need to have more capital to invest. We are committed to expanding our domestic and international business inorganically.
